pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:0.5: 56. The training rule on containing rice
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the Bhagga country at Susumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.2: the monks in the Kokanada stilt house were discarding their bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.4: “How can the Sakyan ascetics discard their bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.5: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.6: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that they do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.11: “… How can those foolish men do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.12: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.13: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.14.1: ‘“I will not discard bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.15: One should not discard bowl-washing water containing rice in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.16: If a monk, out of disrespect, discards bowl-washing water containing rice in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.22: if he discards it after removing the rice, after breaking it up, into a receptacle, or after taking it outside;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.25: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.26: The sixth training rule is finished.
